text: but this is just the most extraordinary
scene we've been hearing about this boat
for the last four or five days through
very very occasional phone calls they've
got out telling of their desperate
plight nobody knew where they were we've
been searching for it trying to work it
out now we've found it it's packed full
of well we can see at least 150 people
on board they say we are from Miami from
Burma their row hinder Muslims and that
they're absolutely desperately hungry
and thirsty they've been calling out to
us for help
we believe help is on the way the tiny
bees come to look at them but we're not
sure how quickly they're gonna get it
we've been throwing them everything we
have all the bottles of water we have on
board but you can see there's there are
women and children on board and they've
made a very long journey we don't know
quite how long they've been at sea but
it could be many many weeks and they've
been abandoned by their crew they've
been towed we believe at one point
across to Malaysia then back to here but
they seem unable to move under their own
power and they've clearly got very
little in the way of food and water on
board so this state is absolutely
desperate but just try to imagine the
state of other boats that might be out
there this one's now been found and
there's some hope of help what we don't
know is what will happen to them now the
countries in this region have been
operating a policy of pushing them back
both Malaysia Thailand and Indonesia and
I think there'll be something of a
tug-of-war about who is going to take
responsibility for these people but
right now what's absolutely clear is
they need help they need it now they
need to get to land
they'll need medical treatment and they
certainly need plenty of food and water
